page.title: 08MODERN USES OF MILLS(2)
page.content: One mill which has remained devoted to textile production is the Coronation Mill,now owned by British Trimmings. Perhaps the most interesting of the old mill sites in this area is the Meadow Mill,situated close to the River Tame,just to the west of Tiviot Way. This mill building has been sub-divided into a large number of smaller work units.Some of these units are still involved in the production of various forms of fabrics,such as furnishings,but these units are in the minority. Many different aspects of industry are reflected in the nature of the firms occupying the rest of the building. These firms are engaged in such diverse activities as metal spinning,engineering and the design and manufacture of greetings cards.
